entry.title: Simplify app-region/Draggable Region implementation
entry.content:
This change restructures how draggable regions are sent to the

browser. App-region is a main-frame-only concept, so instead of

plumbing through generic frame interfaces, this CL plumbs through

local-main-frame interfaces, which avoids ad-hoc IsMainFrame()

security checks.



More details in the "In progress changes" section of:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1TztHzeWy7aFgjspfP6BbTd59OOmr5i7eCgi9fVCi_zo/edit?usp=sharing

entry.title: [extended-updates] Implement Extended Updates settings logic
entry.content:
The main show/hide logic is determined by whether the device/user is

eligible to opt-in and that the device is currently up to date.



Eligibility is determined by logic in the extended updates controller in

the browser process, which the renderer calls via the browser proxy.



Three pieces of information from the update engine affect the

eligibility: whether the device is eol, whether the extended updates

date is passed, and whether the device requires user opt-in. These are

passed to the controller via the browser proxy when determining

eligibility.



The device being up-to-date is determined by updates having been checked

and the update status being UPDATED.



A policy observer is also added to be notified when a user has opted in.

This will update the UI to no longer show the option to opt-in.



Bug: b:322418004

Change-Id: I56dfc3a8c88659f192b0a98c824b917d59877de6

entry.title: Simplify chrome_pdf::ScopedSdkInitializer
entry.content:
ScopedSdkInitializer has an IsSDKInitializedViaPlugin() call that

assumes the call can return true, and skip SDK initialization. This may

have been possible about a decade ago, but modern //pdf code separates

the two types of use cases, as enforced by `public` headers in

//pdf/BUILD.gn:



1) Blink plugin code only run in PDF renderer processes, via

//pdf/pdf_view_web_plugin.h.

2) Various utilities only run in service processes and tests, via

//pdf/pdf.h.



As such, ScopedSdkInitializer is only used in //pdf/pdf.cc, so it only

has to deal with uses cases of type (2). Without any type (1) overlap,

IsSDKInitializedViaPlugin() should always return false.



Change-Id: Idff67d6283d8f6229c5d3e84c7c72f4cd799cce7

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5395192

Commit-Queue: Lei Zhang

Reviewed-by: Andy Phan

entry.title: Refresh app-bound encryption metrics and re-enable them.
entry.content:
The data format for encryption and decryption has changed, as

well as a few issues being resolved.



In order to gather even more data, this CL changes the pref name

(again) and wipes existing data (again) in order to get a full

Encrypt and Decrypt cycle from all clients.



Existing metrics are also renamed to ensure it is possible to

distinguish clients running the newest code from older ones.



Finally, the metrics are enabled by the feature in chrome/browser.



BUG=41493095

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS=OSCrypt.AppBoundEncryption.PathValidation histograms were all replaced by versions with '2' appended to them.

entry.title: Android: Turn off StrictMode.ThreadPolicy
entry.content:
The vast majority of StrictModeContext suppressions are for disk IO,

which is a ThreadPolicy violation. Turning this off in //chrome improves

performance (see https://crbug.com/40279700).



StrictModeContext should still be used in WebView-only code and

WebView-shared code with Chrome.

entry.title: Upgrade aggregation_service DCHECKs to CHECKs, not fatal until M128
entry.content:
This matches latest guidance and should help increase certainty that

these are not being hit in production. We delay this change being fatal

to M128 to allow some temporal leeway and avoid stability risks in case

they are hit. (This gives around four weeks to fix any issues from when

M125 Stable is released before Canary switches to M128.) We do not

upgrade DCHECK_CALLED_ON_VALID_SEQUENCE() as there is no CHECK

equivalent. We also avoid the "not fatal" parameter for code that is not

used in production.



Fuchsia-Binary-Size: Size increase is either not real or unavoidable

Bug: 328089064

Change-Id: I77ff212f99ac3fe9b7d103adcbdd381e01d3d6ed

entry.title: Fix incorrect CanRequestURL() check in PDF code.
entry.content:
The first argument of ChildProcessSecurityPolicy::CanRequestURL()

needs to be a RenderProcessHost ID, but a call site in PDF plugin code

provided a RenderFrameHost's routing ID instead. This has likely been

broken since being introduced in 2017 in

https://codereview.chromium.org/2972123002/.

entry.title: [iOS][Bookmarks] Editor deals with deleted ancestor.
entry.content:
If the node is deleted, the editor is closed.



If the bookmark or folder was going to be moved to a deleted folder

(including by signing-out), the node is moved to Mobile Bookmarks, if

possible of the same model.



This ensure:

* that both kind of editors behaves in a similar way

* that "done" is never ignored (which used to be the case when a node

was moved to a deleted folder

* that if the node is actually deleted, it’s reflected in the view.



Fixed: 330345514

Change-Id: Ia6da53f21821dc73cbc2d412ad1f77d945c8e1ef

entry.title: Switch uses of Pickle to non-owning
entry.content:
While switching usage of Pickle to new creation factories, some usages

were switched to owning the data. This might not have been completely

clear to those OKing the switch, so this CL moves those invocations to

use the non-owning varieties, which matches the behavior of the code

before.



This leaves all the clipboard usage alone, though. That usage was the

driver for the ability to create a Pickle that owns its data in the

first place.



Bug: 330028190

Change-Id: Id2f24db06fb43fdc70e32e7b008a463956b8ed46

entry.title: canvas: adds PaintOp for arcs, and uses it from CanvasPath
entry.content:
CanvasPath gets another builder for arcs, and BaseRenderingContext2D

special cases this type (similar to lines). This helps cases that

repeatedly draw a number of arcs because SkPath::arcTo() is quite

expensive.



This results in some rendering differences. I ran these by Victor

who thought they seemed reasonable.



Note that Yi had done a prototype of this a while back. This work

is based off it.



Bug: 330506337

entry.title: [QuickStart][OOBE] Bug fixes on network screen
entry.content:
Fix an issue on the network screen that caused a brief 'Network not

available' error when adding WiFi credentials using QuickStart. A

short artificial delay (2 seconds) was introduced between the moment

when we are notified that we are connected and the actual

transition to the next screen. This will ensure that the network screen

remains showing the WiFi being transferred a bit longer.



Also move the binding of the Mojo pipe for configuring the network

from a method and into the screen's constructor. Previously, it

would trigger a crash when attempting to set a network for the second

time.



Test: Browsertests & manual verification using Pixelbook & Pixel 7



Bug: b/328677262

Change-Id: Idf5f126a70a52799709d7da4a92aec647b4e5c6f

entry.title: Decouple HistogramController from content internals.
entry.content:
As a first step towards adding support for histograms in (Mac) App

Shims using the existing child process histogram fetching support,

this CL refactors HistogramController to no longer depend

on any content internals. Since content doesn't know anything about

app shims, any functionality needed will need to be exposed via

content/public or components/metrics.



See https://docs.google.com/document/d/19dANu83w-9q-Ft5PU1cxDHiKdZv4hDLyAdr2Zf3JgSc/edit?usp=sharing for more background.

entry.title: Revert "Reapply "Enable Widevine CDM rollback on Linux/ChromeOS""
entry.content:
This reverts commit 3ec80b2b35407e54a8ece4fc55c05ab3dc2af032.



Reason for revert: Crashes on linux



Original change's description:

> Reapply "Enable Widevine CDM rollback on Linux/ChromeOS"

>

> This reverts commit b1646bfdf2c9f2bbe91c5124ea20deb92793c38d.

>

> This change was reverted due to problems with LaCros. Reapplying with a

> flag so that it doesn't by default apply to LaCros. If the flag is

> disabled then the previous behavior is maintained (choose the Component

> Updated version only if it is greater than the bundled version.)

>

> Original change's description:

> > Enable Widevine CDM rollback on Linux/ChromeOS

> >

> > Component Update allows for downgrading components to an earlier

> > version. However, on Linux and ChromeOS, the Widevine CDM needs

> > to be loaded before the zygote is locked, and thus uses a hint

> > file to determine which version is supplied by Component Update.

> > Current checking in cdm_registration uses the larger of the bundled

> > version or the Component Updated version (if both exist), so if the

> > downgrade is to a version prior to the current bundled version, the

> > rollback doesn't work.

> >

> > To fix this, the hint file created when a new component is downloaded

> > is updated to keep track of the bundled version at the time it was

> > downloaded, as Component Update will check the bundled version when

> > determining if a new version is required. If the bundled version

> > matches this saved version, then the bundled version is skipped when

> > checking what should be loaded into the zygote (thus always loading

> > the Component Updated version).

>

> Bug: 41491028

> Test: manual test plus updated unit_tests pass

> Change-Id: I94d941e251f271653c7efad1009293c0bd597d93

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5381848

> Reviewed-by: Joshua Pawlicki

> Commit-Queue: John Rummell

> Reviewed-by: Xiaohan Wang

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1277842}

entry.title: wallpaper: WallpaperPrefManager negative tests
entry.content:
Add some tests to validate wallpaper info creation when the values from

the sync pref are unexpected. These are meant to simulate the cases

where new sync data may be modified in the future.



The CL also adds a new validation for wallpaper layout. From testing,

unknown layout causes the system to crash on boot so it's better if we

prevent syncing when an unknown value is present.



Also adds default handling in switch statement handling wallapper type

with warning so we may get extra logging when new value is added.



BUG=b:324919452

TEST=unit_tests --gtest_filter="WallpaperPrefManagerTest.*"

entry.title: Log metrics for app launches by entity
entry.content:
When a user launches an app, record a metric to understant if the app

was either a default app or a third party app. In order to identify if

the app is a third party app, we use the AppCollection that it belongs

to, and assume that any third party app belongs to the

AppCollection::kUnknown.



This metric will be useful to evaluate the success of the Apps

Collections experiment.

entry.title: Reland "[A11y] Simplify initial serialization steps"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 6028472cab41923e39dd01c16c0bad0ab105b24c



Reason for revert: an issue with EXPECT_DEATH_IF_SUPPORTED

(bug 331226146) is breaking AXTreeSerializerInvalidTest.InvalidChild on

some platforms by comparing the wrong message text. This is not

an issue with the actual AXTreeSerializer changes. Will reland with

the test enabled on just one platform to ensure we have coverage

until the underlying issue is addressed.



Original change's description:

> [A11y] Simplify initial serialization steps

>

> Compute the root as soon as possible, remove unnecessary code paths and enhance code readability. In particular the code to initialize the root is now at the start of a serialization, and we remove a strange do/while loop.

>

> The only test change is that we now expect death when illegal children

> are provided, as we clear a TODO and make the code stricter (now

> that the dependent bugs in that TODO have been fixed).

>

> Bug: none

> Change-Id: Iceef1f5d6f55060692ea3995f403056a99978da2

> Cq-Do-Not-Cancel-Tryjobs: true

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4403840

entry.title: [PWA] Refactoring state machine into AppBannerManager.
entry.content:
This CL is the next incremental step into removing all of the

inheritance in the AppBannerManager system. It does this by:

- Move state mutation back into base class - e.g. stop calling

UpdateState, stop making AppBannerManager member function calls, and

stop other AppBannerManager member variable modification.

- Move logic branching into base class.



The goal is to not have this state machine spread across multiple

classes, which makes it extremely hard to reason about and read.



(no functional changes here)

entry.title: [Android][3PPWM] Assert access to providers ... and restore saving?
entry.content:
The crash report at crbug.com/331310653 is likely inactionable but

investigating the usage of the providers revealed some incorrect

assumptions.

These assumptions are fixed as asserts now.



An assumption in tab_android reinforces that the driver is actually

initialized with the web contents. Since the driver is

lazy-initialized, this may not be relevant. But: fishfooders noted

that saving is unreliable and this could be part of the solution

since driver events are relevant to tracking forms on a page.

Manual testing with this patch showed that saving works reliably

on fhorschig.github.io now.

entry.title: [AvatarButton] Fix signin paused state not clearing on signout + cleanup
entry.content:
Signin paused state was not active anymore, and signing out of Chrome

did not trigger a state change. Listening to primary account change

fixes the issue.



Refactoring parts:

- Cleaned up the StateManager code to only compute new state

internally or by request of StateProvider implementations, to make

sure all the states control the active state and updates properly.

- Injected specific logic of some StateProviders from the

AvatarToolbarButtonDelegate into the StateProvider itself, and

give a way to retrieve the StateProvider from the StateManager

to read the value, when that State is the button active state.

- Removed the icon related updates from the StateManager as they

should not alter the state.

entry.title: Fenced frame: fix CSP tests and CSP check in can load API.
entry.content:
The navigator.canLoadAdAuctionFencedFrame() API currently doesn't

properly handle the case when calling it in a document whose content

security policy is "fenced-frame-src: https:". This is because the API

isn't explicitly checking for that specific case. This CL modifies the

function to match the checks in `CheckCSPSource()` in `csp_source.cc`.



This would've been caught by the CSP WPTs, but those have a bug that

makes them ineffective in catching corner cases. When adding a CSP with

the tag, that is a strictly additive operation, and removing the

tag will have no effect on the document's CSP. Since the same page is

re-used through all the promise_tests in the file, each subsequent test

will load with all of the CSPs set in the prior tests. This CL fixes

that by having each test create a subframe that gets the CSP, and

running the test in that subframe.



This CL also refactors canLoadAdAuctionFencedFrame() to move the CSP

related checks into a helper function in the renderer's

ContentSecurityPolicy class.



Change-Id: Iea3238cc2b515976468f957ae808277df8c5adc9

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5378803

entry.title: [exo]Skip GetWidgetHitTestMask if root_surface is null
entry.content:
When root_surface is destroyed ShellSurfaceBase::OnSurfaceDestroying()

calls SetRootSurface() first, then calls widget_->Hide().

widget_->Hide() can lead to DispatchMouseExitToHidingWindow() which will

perform hitttes on the ShellSurfaceBase again, so we need to perform a

nullptr check in GetWidgetHitTestMask().

entry.title: crosier: Fix and re-enable login related tests
entry.content:
It turns out that `GaiaPageEventWaiter` has timing issues. It

waits for `ready` event from JS Authenticator when the waiter is

created. However, the JS Authenticator could be re-created

during reload. When that happens, `GaiaPageEventWaiter` will

not be able to get the `ready` event and eventually times out.

This CL replaces `GaiaPageEventWaiter` with a JS expr on

"gaia-signin" element that is not recreated during reload and

wait for its properties:

!hidden && uiStep === 'online-gaia'.



Bug: 325519819

Change-Id: I95b6374696b1652f48707ddbbaf428746338b4ff

entry.title: Bookmarks: fix restore focus after delete
entry.content:
A prior CL subtly changed focus behavior for

chrome://bookmarks when deleting bookmarks. Other WebUIs can

batch store property updates together, but list.ts relies on

specific property update order in order to maintain focus.

list.displayedIds_ must be updated first before

list.selectedItems_, as onDisplayedIdsChanged_ requires

accessing the old list.selectedItems_ value.



Prior CL:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4763926



Now that bookmarks is the only consumer of

//ui/webui/resources/cr_elements/store_client and all ash

usages have been migrated to

//ash//webui/common/resources/cr_elements/store_client,

restore the original sequential property update behavior.



Bug: b:40075477

Test: browser_tests --gtest_filter=*BookmarksTest.List*

Change-Id: I417720e10332cb6b8f46cf55c9cb6859c42a2d06

entry.title: Skip the second content_window Show() if already visible
entry.content:
Since crrev.com/c/5366914, DesktopWindowTreeHostPlatform observes

compositor() visibility change and will show or hide content_window

accordingly.



As a result, DesktopWindowTreeHostPlatform::Show() calls content_window

Show() twice, 1st from compositor()->SetVisible(), 2nd directly calling

Show().



If a widget wants to do fade-in, it can set opacity to 0.f, then call

DesktopWindowTreeHostPlatform::Show(), this cause the second

content_window->Show() to fail a dcheck:

DCHECK(!visible_ || layer()->GetTargetOpacity() > 0.0f);



Assuming Show() can have side effects such as triggering an animator,

calling it a second time should be avoided.



Bug: None

Change-Id: Ide99eda0d071a25c7f86c793b319d1289cb47dc9

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5388775

Reviewed-by: Scott Violet

Commit-Queue: Kramer Ge

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1278325}

entry.title: Introduce RenderWidgetHostViewInput interface.
entry.content:
This change introduces a new interface RenderWidgetHostViewInput which

will be implemented by Browser and Viz to help handling input events.

This change is part of chain of CLs which will move input targeting and

dispatching related code to common input code allowing Viz to use it

without duplication for project InputVizard.

(https://docs.google.com/document/d/1mcydbkgFCO_TT9NuFE962L8PLJWT2XOfXUAPO88VuKE/edit?usp=sharing)

This interface is intentionally unused at present. This separation aims

to improve code reviewability by keeping CLs focused and will be

utilized in subsequent dependent changes.

entry.title: Fenced frames: Cancel in-progress requests upon network revocation [3/N]
entry.content:
Previously, when revoking network for a nonce, we only disabled new

requests under that nonce.

Now, upon revoking a nonce we also iterate over all active requests

and cancel those matching the nonce.

entry.title: Allow peeking at the gpu::Mailbox used by a GPUTexture.
entry.content:
`endWebGPUAccess` will need to retrieve the gpu::Mailbox from an

existing GPUTexture. This should always be possible because we

control `beginWebGPUAccess`, and its textures are created in a

predictable way (via a shared image). The prerequisite accessors

are added in this CL. Also, GPUTextures now hold on to the

gpu::Mailbox name post-construction, so it can be retrieved later.

These are small (16 bytes?) so should be a negligible cost.



`endWebGPUAccess` now invokes the accessors and checks that they

returned reasonable values. In a followup, the mailbox will be used

to replace the canvas' image.



Bug: 41490345

Change-Id: I76b04db63a89521ef9edfcba08c409e210ceae2b

entry.title: HistoryServiceObserver: Rename OnURLsDeleted to OnHistoryDeletions
entry.content:
OnURLsDeleted was always a bit of a misnomer because DeletionInfo could

specify a lot more detail than which URLs were deleted.



In this recent CL, we made DeletionInfo also contain which visits were

deleted, so it's become even more of a misnomer.



This CL renames OnURLsDeleted to the more general name:

OnHistoryDeletions.

entry.title: reclient: Set -lifetime 5m for luci-auth
entry.content:
reproxy wants to refresh a token once its lifetime is less than 5

minutes. However, luci-auth by default does not refresh a token until

its lifetime is less than 1 minute.



This leads to reproxy asking luci-auth for a new token too early, which

causes luci-auth to just return the same token as before, which causes

reproxy to become very confused why luci-auth doesn't understand the

urgency of the situation. Flabbergasted about luci-auth's unwillingness

to cooperate, reproxy has some sort of a black-out and forgets

everything it was ever taught about how to handle tokens correctly. All

requests start to fail with an "Unauthenticated" error and the build

fails.



Luckily luci-auth has a flag to set the minimum lifetime for token

refresh, so we can set it to 5 minutes to match reproxy's expectations.

With their mismatched expectations finally resolved, the two lived

happily ever after.



The end.



Bug: b/331341793

entry.title: Fix DOMArrayBuffer::IsDetached()
entry.content:
A DOMArrayBuffer was maintaining its own "is_detached_" state, and

would consider itself non-detached even if the corresponding

JSArrayBuffer (or, all of them, in case there are several) was

detached.



Piping in the v8::Isolate would be a too big change for this fix, so this is using v8::Isolate::GetCurrent() for now.

entry.title: Make MatchesAllOriginsAndDomains return false for partition restrictions
entry.content:
Many places use an optimized "return true" callback instead of a full

storage matching implementation when MatchesAllOriginsAndDomains()

returns true. But it could return true even when several storage

partitioning restrictions were set on the filter, leading to deleting

more storage than intended.



This CL makes MatchesAllOriginsAndDomains() return false if any such

restrictions are set.
